verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon Shoshannim <S%H7799><s%>, A Psalm of David <S%H1732><s%>. Save <S%H3467><s%> me, O God <S%H430><s%>; for the waters <S%H4325><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> in unto my soul <S%H5315><s%>.

I sink <S%H2883><s%> in deep <S%H4688><s%> mire <S%H3121><s%>, where there is no standing <S%H4613><s%>: I am come <S%H935><s%> into deep <S%H4615><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>, where the floods <S%H7641><s%> overflow <S%H7857><s%> me. deep mire: Heb. the mire of depth deep waters: Heb. depth of waters
I am weary <S%H3021><s%> of my crying <S%H7121><s%>: my throat <S%H1627><s%> is dried <S%H2787><s%>: mine eyes <S%H5869><s%> fail <S%H3615><s%> while I wait <S%H3176><s%> for my God <S%H430><s%>.

They that hate <S%H8130><s%> me without a cause <S%H2600><s%> are more <S%H7231><s%> than the hairs <S%H8185><s%> of mine head <S%H7218><s%>: they that would destroy <S%H6789><s%> me, being mine enemies <S%H341><s%> wrongfully <S%H8267><s%>, are mighty <S%H6105><s%>: then I restored <S%H7725><s%> that which I took not away <S%H1497><s%>.
O God <S%H430><s%>, thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> my foolishness <S%H200><s%>; and my sins <S%H819><s%> are not hid <S%H3582><s%> from thee. sins: Heb. guiltiness

Let not them that wait <S%H6960><s%> on thee, O Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, be ashamed <S%H954><s%> for my sake: let not those that seek <S%H1245><s%> thee be confounded <S%H3637><s%> for my sake, O God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.
Because for thy sake I have borne <S%H5375><s%> reproach <S%H2781><s%>; shame <S%H3639><s%> hath covered <S%H3680><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%>.
I am become a stranger <S%H2114><s%> unto my brethren <S%H251><s%>, and an alien <S%H5237><s%> unto my mother's <S%H517><s%> children <S%H1121><s%>.
For the zeal <S%H7068><s%> of thine house <S%H1004><s%> hath eaten me up <S%H398><s%>; and the reproaches <S%H2781><s%> of them that reproached <S%H2778><s%> thee are fallen <S%H5307><s%> upon me.
When I wept <S%H1058><s%>, and chastened my soul <S%H5315><s%> with fasting <S%H6685><s%>, that was to my reproach <S%H2781><s%>.
I made <S%H5414><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> also my garment <S%H3830><s%>; and I became a proverb <S%H4912><s%> to them.

They that sit in <S%H3427><s%> the gate <S%H8179><s%> speak <S%H7878><s%> against me; and I was the song <S%H5058><s%> of the drunkards <S%H8354><s%> <S%H7941><s%>. drunkards: Heb. drinkers of strong drink

But as for me, my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is unto thee, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, in an acceptable <S%H7522><s%> time <S%H6256><s%>: O God <S%H430><s%>, in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy mercy <S%H2617><s%> hear <S%H6030><s%> me, in the truth <S%H571><s%> of thy salvation <S%H3468><s%>.

Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me out of the mire <S%H2916><s%>, and let me not sink <S%H2883><s%>: let me be delivered <S%H5337><s%> from them that hate <S%H8130><s%> me, and out of the deep <S%H4615><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%>.

Let not the waterflood <S%H4325><s%> <S%H7641><s%> overflow <S%H7857><s%> me, neither let the deep <S%H4688><s%> swallow me up <S%H1104><s%>, and let not the pit <S%H875><s%> shut <S%H332><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> upon me.

Hear <S%H6030><s%> me, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>; for thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%>: turn <S%H6437><s%> unto me according to the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of thy tender mercies <S%H7356><s%>.
And hide <S%H5641><s%> not thy face <S%H6440><s%> from thy servant <S%H5650><s%>; for I am in trouble <S%H6887><s%>: hear <S%H6030><s%> me speedily <S%H4118><s%>. hear: Heb. make haste to hear me
Draw nigh <S%H7126><s%> unto my soul <S%H5315><s%>, and redeem <S%H1350><s%> it: deliver <S%H6299><s%> me because of mine enemies <S%H341><s%>.
Thou hast known <S%H3045><s%> my reproach <S%H2781><s%>, and my shame <S%H1322><s%>, and my dishonour <S%H3639><s%>: mine adversaries <S%H6887><s%> are all before thee.

Reproach <S%H2781><s%> hath broken <S%H7665><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%>; and I am full of heaviness <S%H5136><s%>: and I looked <S%H6960><s%> for some to take pity <S%H5110><s%>, but there was none; and for comforters <S%H5162><s%>, but I found <S%H4672><s%> none. to take: Heb. to lament with me
They gave <S%H5414><s%> me also gall <S%H7219><s%> for my meat <S%H1267><s%>; and in my thirst <S%H6772><s%> they gave me vinegar <S%H2558><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%>.
Let their table <S%H7979><s%> become a snare <S%H6341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them: and that which should have been for their welfare <S%H7965><s%>, let it become a trap <S%H4170><s%>.
Let their eyes <S%H5869><s%> be darkened <S%H2821><s%>, that they see <S%H7200><s%> not; and make their loins <S%H4975><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%> to shake <S%H4571><s%>.
Pour out <S%H8210><s%> thine indignation <S%H2195><s%> upon them, and let thy wrathful <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> take hold <S%H5381><s%> of them.

Let their habitation <S%H2918><s%> be desolate <S%H8074><s%>; and let none dwell <S%H3427><s%> in their tents <S%H168><s%>. their habitation: Heb. their palace let none: Heb. let there not be a dweller

For they persecute <S%H7291><s%> him whom thou hast smitten <S%H5221><s%>; and they talk <S%H5608><s%> to the grief <S%H4341><s%> of those whom thou hast wounded <S%H2491><s%>. those: Heb. thy wounded
Add <S%H5414><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> unto their iniquity <S%H5771><s%>: and let them not come <S%H935><s%> into thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%>. iniquity unto: or, punishment of iniquity, etc
Let them be blotted <S%H4229><s%> out of the book <S%H5612><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%>, and not be written <S%H3789><s%> with the righteous <S%H6662><s%>.
But I am poor <S%H6041><s%> and sorrowful <S%H3510><s%>: let thy salvation <S%H3444><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, set me up on high <S%H7682><s%>.
I will praise <S%H1984><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> with a song <S%H7892><s%>, and will magnify <S%H1431><s%> him with thanksgiving <S%H8426><s%>.
This also shall please <S%H3190><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> better <S%H3190><s%> than an ox <S%H7794><s%> or bullock <S%H6499><s%> that hath horns <S%H7160><s%> and hoofs <S%H6536><s%>.
The humble <S%H6035><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> this, and be glad <S%H8055><s%>: and your heart <S%H3824><s%> shall live <S%H2421><s%> that seek <S%H1875><s%> God <S%H430><s%>. humble: or, meek
For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> heareth <S%H8085><s%> the poor <S%H34><s%>, and despiseth <S%H959><s%> not his prisoners <S%H615><s%>.
Let the heaven <S%H8064><s%> and earth <S%H776><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> him, the seas <S%H3220><s%>, and every thing that moveth <S%H7430><s%> therein. moveth: Heb. creepeth

For God <S%H430><s%> will save <S%H3467><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>, and will build <S%H1129><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>: that they may dwell <S%H3427><s%> there, and have it in possession <S%H3423><s%>.
The seed <S%H2233><s%> also of his servants <S%H5650><s%> shall inherit <S%H5157><s%> it: and they that love <S%H157><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> therein.
